channel.title: Idle timer
channel.description: Hello, I got an idle timer that is around 90 seconds. (After 90 seconds, you automatically logout). I'm unsure of what I should be looking for in order to remove this. Can anybody help? This is an annoying issue.

item.title: Idle timer
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Last I recall, or according to the packet documentation it’s packet 0:
Anyways, you can use the Timer or timerTask

[code=java]if(someTimer = 0) {
// Do stuff
}

boolean process()
{
…
someTimer–;
}[/code]

Well, from the back of my head, thats what I remember.

Edit:

Forgive my absentmindedness, I just took a quick review of the packet documentation and the idle packet is 0, the idle logout packet is 202.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: Idle timer
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“l skinner l, post:2, topic:388175”]i had this same problem you can go into the server an search idl if you want. i have this inside mine after i deleted this i had no problem if your server a 317 then look in your client.

case 0: break; // idle packet - keeps on reseting timeOutCounter case 202: // idle logout packet if(!inCombat) logout(); break;
if you have something close to that or just search idle inside client. yourwelcome.[/quote]

case 202: /** *idle logout packet *if(!inCombat) *logout(); **/ break;

Read full topic

item.title: Idle timer
item.dc:creator: @l_skinner_l l skinner l
item.description:
@l_skinner_l wrote:

i had this same problem you can go into the server an search idl if you want. i have this inside mine after i deleted this i had no problem if your server a 317 then look in your client.

case 0: break; // idle packet - keeps on reseting timeOutCounter case 202: // idle logout packet if(!inCombat) logout(); break;
if you have something close to that or just search idle inside client. yourwelcome.

Read full topic
